intro: Euphrasia alpina proles capcirensis, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. It produces numerous small, seed-like fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its range.
